{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3416876,"name":"Chris_Elston","username":"Chris_Elston","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/chris_elston/{size}/256883_2.png","created_at":"2024-08-20T19:23:16.675Z","cooked":"

Why don’t the suppliers offer pre-anodized 2"x1" tube in different colors for those of us who don’t have a “Colors Inc” company in our backyard?

I am pretty sure my team would pay more for the tube even if it has a cut edge, it would still help rather than painting the tube later or other things like that.

Churro tube, shaft collars, peanut tube can be purchased in many colors now. Unless I overlooked a source for this? Is it really expensive to do a 2x1 tube? Automation direct and 80-20 offer black extrusion tube.

Just asking for a friend.

cc @BWJN
You seem to alwase be looking for stuff rn. Also my frends on 2877 LigerBots would probably find that supper awsome to use as long it is reletivly afordable.

From my understanding is that Pre-Anodizing make machining more difficult. I have never done it to be able to tell you one way or another but that’s what I’ve read

If it was sold as punched tube than that would probably avoid most of the struggles.

Ah, okay, makes sense.

I am mostly a software person, so I didn’t know that.

But if we are just cutting it with a chop saw or band saw, that should be okay I assume? We’ve cut pre-anodize churro tube before this way and nothing bad seems to happen.

We used our CNC on anodized box tubing before and it seemed to be fine

","post_number":6,"post_type":1,"posts_count":12,"updated_at":"2024-08-21T09:54:00.646Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":3,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":265,"readers_count":264,"score":68.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":470056,"topic_slug":"pre-anodize-2-x1-tube-supplier","display_username":"Cameron Blue","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":2,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":25951,"username":"Technologyman00","name":"Technologyman00","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/technologyman00/{size}/178178_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":60126,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/pre-anodize-2-x1-tube-supplier/470056/6","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3416892,"name":"Chris Bale","username":"cbale2000","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/cbale2000/{size}/2142_2.png","created_at":"2024-08-20T19:46:36.448Z","cooked":"
Chris_Elston:

Why don’t the suppliers offer pre-anodized 2"x1" tube in different colors for those of us who don’t have a “Colors Inc” company in our backyard?

I am pretty sure my team would pay more for the tube even if it has a cut edge, it would still help rather than painting the tube later or other things like that.

Churro tube, shaft collars, peanut tube can be purchased in many colors now. Unless I overlooked a source for this? Is it really expensive to do a 2x1 tube? Automation direct and 80-20 offer black extrusion tube.

Just asking for a friend.

For what it’s worth, our team is based out of central Michigan and we’ve worked with Colors Inc before after an Indiana team suggested them to us. We basically just bulk-ordered a bunch of stock material from Vex a few years back, had it shipped to Colors Inc, who then shipped it to us when they were done with it. Since it was more stock than just getting some parts for a robot done it wasn’t free, but they still gave us a great price on it.

To answer the your main question though, “why don’t companies just stock this stuff?”, it comes down to how much inventory a company can realistically stock. Warehouse space costs money, and every additional color you stock is another SKU you have to keep in inventory. Then there’s the matter of predicting demand, since not every color will be equally as in-demand as others.

In general, vendors (especially ones that aren’t huge corporations) want to minimize the number of different items they have to stock, and make their products as generally applicable to as many customers as possible.

The only other practical solution would be to create an “on-demand” service, where you did the anodizing in-house at the request of the customer to their color preferences, but this adds an entire layer of extra labor and manufacturing complexity, so it’s not ideal either.

","post_number":7,"post_type":1,"posts_count":12,"updated_at":"2024-08-20T19:47:57.009Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":254,"readers_count":253,"score":150.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":470056,"topic_slug":"pre-anodize-2-x1-tube-supplier","display_username":"Chris Bale","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":4}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":6560,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/pre-anodize-2-x1-tube-supplier/470056/7","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":3},{"id":"point_up","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":4,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3416893,"name":"Chris_Elston","username":"Chris_Elston","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/chris_elston/{size}/256883_2.png","created_at":"2024-08-20T19:48:20.614Z","cooked":"

Business sense is always the best sense. Thanks for explaining that perspective.

","post_number":8,"post_type":1,"posts_count":12,"updated_at":"2024-08-20T19:48:20.614Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":7,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":218,"readers_count":217,"score":43.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":470056,"topic_slug":"pre-anodize-2-x1-tube-supplier","display_username":"Chris_Elston","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":6560,"username":"cbale2000","name":"Chris Bale","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/cbale2000/{size}/2142_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":3040,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/pre-anodize-2-x1-tube-supplier/470056/8","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3416894,"name":"","username":"Akash_Rastogi","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/akash_rastogi/{size}/169937_2.png","created_at":"2024-08-20T19:52:07.628Z","cooked":"

One other thing to consider is that anodizing won’t mask an imperfect surface finish. I’d wager no vendor currently has any materials handling practices that would keep surfaces nice and pretty for anodizing, and in bulk production - cleaning up the surface before anodizing sounds like it would probably be a hassle.

","post_number":9,"post_type":1,"posts_count":12,"updated_at":"2024-08-20T19:52:07.628Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":223,"readers_count":222,"score":64.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":470056,"topic_slug":"pre-anodize-2-x1-tube-supplier","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":8002,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"177 & 429 | #TeamWCP| #TeamThrifty"},"post_url":"/t/pre-anodize-2-x1-tube-supplier/470056/9","custom_user_title":"177 & 429 | #TeamWCP| #TeamThrifty","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3416895,"name":"829 The Digital Goats Official Curmudgeon. ","username":"IndySam","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/indysam/{size}/111341_2.png","created_at":"2024-08-20T19:59:13.758Z","cooked":"
Chris_Elston:

Why don’t the suppliers offer pre-anodized 2"x1" tube in different colors for those of us who don’t have a “Colors Inc” company in our backyard?

Have you spoken with Colors Inc? The new owners are nice and may not offer same day turn around the still did all our stuff for free.

Longer stock requires them to use the long tanks which limits the colors they may do for free but if you give them pleanty of lead time they would probabbly just throw your stuff in when those tanks are already running.

","post_number":10,"post_type":1,"posts_count":12,"updated_at":"2024-08-20T19:59:13.758Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":2,"reads":217,"readers_count":216,"score":88.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":470056,"topic_slug":"pre-anodize-2-x1-tube-supplier","display_username":"829 The Digital Goats Official Curmudgeon. ","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":2}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":5305,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/pre-anodize-2-x1-tube-supplier/470056/10","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1},{"id":"point_up","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":2,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3417134,"name":"Chris_Elston","username":"Chris_Elston","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/chris_elston/{size}/256883_2.png","created_at":"2024-08-21T14:59:30.441Z","cooked":"

I like the suggestion of [cbale2000] above. I think what we will try to do is pre-order some stock, send it away now while we have time.

The timing of Colors Inc is not great for us in NE Indiana. But if we pre-order it, drop it off and pick it up, it might be then if we go through all that now in the fall. It’s a 2 hour trip for us to do that one way. So I’ll check into this plan. Thanks Old Goat.
